Es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales 4 tiene a su cargo los que ha formado exitosamente ya que son personas de bien al igual que ella. 

Actualmente, está solicitando su quinto crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, zinc y cemento con el fin de construir una habitación para brindarles mejor comodidad a sus hijos, ya que con su trabajo y los créditos que ha obtenido de Ceprodel poco a poco ha ido logrando su objetivo de tener una vivienda digna donde habitar en conjunto con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ceprodel is known for supporting the dreams of educators and teachers.  Every day they very diligently do their small part towards the development of the country through education.

Josefa devotes herself to teaching in the El Sauce municipality.  She lives there, and she has a lot of experience in the field of teaching children.  She is the mother of five children, four of whom are under her care.  They have matured successfully, and they are good people just like their mother. 

She is currently requesting her fifth loan in order to continue improving her home.  She will buy bricks, zinc sheeting, and cement in order to build a room.  This will make her children more comfortable.  

With her work and the loans she has gotten from Ceprodel she has, little by little, been achieving her objective of having a decent house to live in with her children.

loans.use: to buy bricks, zinc sheeting, and cement.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, tiene casa propia y ahi vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo. 
Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habiacion, hace 5 años que inicio con su negocio en el cual vende todo tipo de productos como ser: abarrotaría, refrescos, granos básicos, carnes, embutidos y otros productos.  También posee un molino para moler maiz. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, lacteos, embutidos, carnes y granos basicos, desea surtir su pulperia para que sus ventas mejoren.
las ganancias las necesita para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is 42 years old. She has her own house and lives there with her two children and her husband.

Rosa sells basic consumer products. She has a grocery store in her house. She began it 5 years ago. She sells every type of product, such as groceries, soft drinks, basic grains, meats, sausages, and other products. She also has a mill for grinding corn.

She will use the loan to purchase groceries, milk products, sausages, meats, and basic grains. She wants to stock her grocery store so that her sales improve. She needs the earnings to offer a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries, milk products, sausages, meats, and basic grains

loans.name: Laura Mercedes

texts.es: Laura Mercedes es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio con mucho esfuerzos ya que necesitaba generar ingresos a la familia en el se arriesga si saber nada del negocio pero atreves del tiempo ella va adquiriendo experiencia en el negocio ahora hasta consejo le brinda a sus clientes que la visita. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de variedad de ropa, cosméticos para esta temporada alta.
texts.en:
Laura Mercedes is an entrepreneur who began her own business with much effort because she needed to generate income for the family. 

She took a risk, not knowing anything about business at the time. She is getting experience in the business and now she gives advice to her customers who visit.

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to invest in the business to buy a variety of clothing and cosmetics for the peak season.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and cosmetics for the peak season.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a twenty-eight-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. For five years he has been dealing in phone accessories, after previously working as a fisherman. His dream is to buy land and construct commercial houses. He also has a long term ambition of becoming a dealer for one of the telecom companies. Patrick wants this loan to buy a generator, cell phones, and phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy a generator, cell phones, and phone accessories.

loans.name: Ansor

texts.ru: Ансор женат, ему 27 лет. На воспитании имеет двоих детей. Он учитель, преподает в средней школе. Одна зарплата не хватает на содержание семьи и для этого он дополнительно занимается скотоводством. Более 6 лет он занимается этим бизнесом . Он покупает скот на скотном рынке и подкармливает их дома в течении 3- 4 недель. А потом, когда они набирают вес, продает за хорошую цену. Ансор хотел бы получить займ в размере 1200 Сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Ansor is 27 years old and married.  He is raising two children.  He is a teacher and works at a secondary school.  One salary is not enough to support the family, and, to supplement it, Ansor is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for over six years.  He buys livestock at a livestock market and fattens it up at home for 3-4 weeks.  And then, when livestock gains weight, he sells it at a good price.  Ansor wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1200 Somoni to purchase cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Norte Grande Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Norte Grande” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de abarrotes,  confección de cortinas, venta de helados, venta de ropa nueva, entre otros rubros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Renca, ciudad de Santiago.
Adriana integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer puesto de derecha a izquierda, quien además usa una polera floreada con colores lilas y negros, su pantalón es de color negro y su pelo es color castaño claro que además lo usa suelto al hombro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes desde hace 1 año aproximadamente. Sus productos los compra al por mayor en una distribuidora del barrio “Meiggs” ciudad de Santiago.
Adriana además cuenta con su propio bazar, en el cual aprovecha de vender los perfumes.
Con el crédito comprará perfumes para abastecer su negocio.
Adriana vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es remodelar su casa.
Las motivaciones de comenzar y continuar con el negocio se deben a que Adriana necesita colaborar con los gastos económicos de su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Además comenta que dispone de su casa para realizar las reuniones del Banco comunal, lo cual también ha sido útil para unir al grupo y generar una mayor confianza.
Por otro lado con las capacitaciones ha aprendido nuevas estrategias de contabilidad e inversión, lo cual le servirá en su negocio.
Renca es una comuna ubicada en el sector norponiente del Santiago (capital de Chile), región metropolitana. Es una comuna con un fuerte trabajo comunitario, entre lo que se destaca el canal de televisión comunitario “Renca TV”, creado con el fin de promover las actividades culturales y artísticas de la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Norte Grande," and is made up of 19 entrepreneurs, who work in various areas, that include a grocery store, curtain-making, selling ice cream, selling new clothes, and other activities. They all live in Renca commune (municipality) in the city of Santiago.  

Adriana is a member of the communal bank, and appears in the photo, sitting in the first row. She is the first person going from right to left, wearing a flowered lilac and black T-shirt and black pants. She has light brown hair, worn loose to her shoulders. 

She has been selling perfumes for approximately a year. She buys her products at wholesale from a distributor in the Meiggs neighborhood of the city of Santiago. In addition, Adriana has her own store, which she makes good use of in selling the perfumes. With the loan, she will buy perfumes for stocking her business.

Adriana lives with her husband, and one of her personal dreams is to remodel her home. The motivation for starting the business and keeping it going, is that Adriana needs to contribute to her family's household expenses. 

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow her to invest in her business. She also says that she makes her home available for the meetings of the communal bank, which has also been useful for bringing the group closer together, and creating greater trust. 

Furthermore, through the training, she has learned new strategies for keeping accounts and for investment, which will be useful in her business.

Renca is a commune (municipality) located in the northwest area of the Santiago Metropolitan Region (Santiago is Chile's capital). It is a commune with a strong community focus, highlighted by the community television channel, Renca TV, created with the aim of promoting the commune's cultural and artistic activities.

loans.use: To buy perfumes to stock her business.

loans.name: Bashir Aveo

texts.en: Bashir operates a retail shop in Masindi, Uganda. He is 42 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his five children and wife. Inadequate capital as well as high fuel and transportation costs are his major challenges. He desires to educate his children and buy a motorcycle as another source of income. Bashir wants a loan to buy sugar, salt, and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and rice for resale

loans.name: Luís Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Luís Manuel es originario del bello municipio de El Sauce, es una persona luchadora en conjunto con su familia con muchas visiones propuestas para salir adelante y mejorar su vivienda donde habita con su amada esposa e hijos.

Su negocio consiste en brindar servicio de acarreo a instituciones de dicho municipio, también elaborar y vender sorbetes a todos los pobladores y sus visitantes puesto que tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad donde trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos quienes le apoyan arduamente en la venta de los deliciosos sorbetes que con gran entusiasmo vende.

Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un crédito para la compra de conos y sabores para la elaboración de los sorbetes y de igual manera, comprará algunas llantas para el medio de transporte con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, brindar un mejor servicio y por ende producir más ganancia para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Luís Manuel is from the lovely municipality of El Sauce.  He is a tenacious person.  He, together with his family, has a lot of visions and proposals to get ahead and to improve the house where he lives with his beloved wife and children.

His business consists of providing transportation services to institutions in the municipality.  He also makes and sells sorbet to inhabitants and visitors.  He has been doing this business activity for several years.  He works with his children.  They strongly support him in the sales of the delicious sorbets, which he sells with great enthusiasm.

One of the things he needs at this time is a loan to buy cones and flavoring to make the sorbets.  He will also buy some tires for his mode of transportation in order to meet his customer demand.  He will provide better service, which will produce more income for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy cones and flavoring to make the sorbets.  He will also buy some tires for his mode of transportation.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene 57 años de edad, en el cual su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación sus clientes son vecinos y los de alrededor de su comunidad donde ella habita. Ella tiene 2 hijos pero uno es que esta a su cargo, siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y tener su propio negocio lo cual emprende este negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia. Rosa Maria está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos de la pulpería como granos básicos, aceite, golosinas entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 57 years old. she has a small grocery store, which is located in her home. Her clients are neighbours and people from her local community. 

She has two children, but only one is in her care. She has always liked being independent and having her own business, which she started in order to create income for her family.

Rosa Maria is asking for financing in order to buy stock for her small grocery stores like bulk grains, oil and sweets, among other products that her clients have requested.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, oil and sweets, amongst other products that her clients request.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 24-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband. They are both working hard to build a family and be able to live as they believe they should. In 2010, her husband started to work at a local company. As for her, she decided to open her own home products shop in 2007. She looks forward to growing her business. She sells home products and accessories at fair prices, which is what make her customers loyal to her. Today, she wants to borrow a youth loan of $1,700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy additional home supplies for her shop such as kitchen tools, plastic items and many others. She’s sure that buying these new supplies will help her earn superior income. In the future, she plans to work as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy additional home supplies for her shop such as kitchen tools, plastic items and others

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings, one who is working. They all depend on the father, who is the main source of income for them. Despite his young age, Alaa has opened his own car rental shop in 2009 and has the ambition to grow in this domain. He works on a free-lance basis. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan of $2,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed tools to be able to perform the needed maintenance on the cars he rents. This will allow him continue his work in a proper way without facing problems. In the future, he plans to open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to purchase the needed tools to be able to perform the needed maintenance on the cars he rents

loans.name: Basel

texts.en: Basel is a 29-year-old single man living on his own. He strives to work really hard in order to enrich his life and cover its heavy costs. Basel began to work as a painter in 2006 and has ten years of experience. He has gained clients from different areas because of his good reputation and well organized work. Today, he’s looking for a youth loan of $1800 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added painting tools and enlarge his business. This Kiva loan will boost his productivity thus his earnings. In the future, he plans to take bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting tools and enlarge his business

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only one school aged child. He’s the main income provider in the family and look to satisfy their needs. He started to work as a car black smith and painting in 2005 and has his own garage. He’s expert in his filed especially after fifteen years of experience in this domain. Till now he got a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he needs to borrow $3000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical equipment for his garage. This will help him continue his work in a proper way and respond to his customers’ demands the fastest. In the future, he plans to improve his garage and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his garage

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 21-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his parents and five siblings, four of whom are employed. His father provides most of the family's income, but Hussein is always ready to help whenever needed. In 2009, he went into business as a painter and now has a good reputation and a fair number of customers. He is applying for a loan for $800 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new painting tools so that his equipment is up-to-date and he can improve his business. His goal is to attract new customers and, eventually, open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to buy new tools for a painting business.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 30-year-old Lebanese woman.  She is single, living with her parents and three siblings who are all working.  Her father is trying his best to offer them a suitable life.  For this reason, Samah decided to start her own business in order to take some of the responsibilities off of her father. 

She opened her own CD and recharge card shop in 2005 where she also sells perfumes and some related accessories.  In parallel, she has been working as a teacher for the past seven years. Today, she wants to borrow a youth loan of $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional CDs and recharge cards.  She notes that this will increase her sales and thus her revenues.  In the future, she plans to add cell phones to her shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional CDs and recharge cards

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 19-year-old single Lebanese man. He’s living with his parents and three working siblings. His father works hard to satisfy the family needs and provide help if it’s needed. Hussein has been working in aluminum since 2006. He is an expert in this field and knows very well how to select the products he needs. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan of 1,100 USD from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a minivan for his business. This loan will facilitate his business operations. In the future, he plans to join a local company where he can benefit from their experience.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan for his aluminum business

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. His father strives to work really hard in order to enrich their way of living and cover heavy living costs. Moussa started his own business as a furniture painter in 2008 and already has ten years of experience in this domain. He has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he has the intention to borrow a youth loan of $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new painting tools and develop his business. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools to develop his business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old Lebanese who is a married man.  He lives with his wife and only has one child who is still studying.  He strives to work really hard in order to fulfill his family needs. 

Ahmad has been working in decorating and installing Gypsum since 2006.  He is good in his domain and has his loyal and trusty customers. Today, he has the intention to take a youth loan of $2,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of Gypsum boards for his new projects, in order to be able to accomplish his work in a perfect way as it should be.  In the future, he plans to take bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: To purchase the needed quantity of Gypsum board for his new projects.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with one parent and three siblings. His father fulfills the family needs and demands and two other siblings are also working.  

With the intention to help his father take care of the family, Mohammad has courageously started his own business despite his young age. He has been working as a plumber on a freelance basis since 2009, and has gained a fair number of customers. 

Mohammad would like to borrow $2,000 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. so he can purchase a minivan for his plumbing business. This will facilitate his transportation, especially when he needs to travel to his customers' homes. In the future, he plans to take on new and larger projects.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan for his plumbing business.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en: Karam is a 23-year-old man. He is single, living with his parents and three siblings, one who is working. His father is the main income provider for the family and ready to support them as much as he can. Karam started to work on a free-lance basis in 2009. He has specialized in fixing and installing air conditioning. Today, he is looking for a youth loan of $1,300 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed equipment for his business such as electrical tubes, keys and many other items. He anticipates that this will facilitate his business operations and thus increase his earnings. In the future, he plans to open his own electronics shop.

loans.use: to purchase electrical tubes, keys and other items for his air conditioning business

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 43 years old and has two children. He sells cloth and dressmaking supplies in Malindi town and has been in the business for two years earning a monthly profit of 12,000 KES. 

Alphonce  is requesting is second loan from KADET LTD for 39,500 KES, which he use to purchase clothe materials for making dresses.  He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He will save the anticipated profit to help take care of his family and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Alphonce hopes to expand his business and venture into other investments.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
la joven Ana tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 1 hijo y tiene su casa propia ubicada en la aldea el pedrerito la montaña, juntos con su esposo han trabajado fuerte para tener lo que tienen hasta ahora. Ana se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para atender a sus clientes, su negocio opera de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, granos basicos, lacteos, carnes y refrescos.
desea surtir su negocio para lograr mejores ganancias, su meta para este nuevo año es mejorar su calidad de vida y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Young Ana is 25 years old, she's married and is the mother of a child. She has her own home located in the small village El Pedrerito in La Montaña. Together with her husband, she has worked hard to get where she is today.

Ana sells groceries and has a small grocery store. Everyday she gets up early to attend to her customers, her business is open Monday to Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy groceries, bulk grains, dairy products, meats and soft drinks.

She wants to grow her business to earn greater earnings, her goal for this new year is to improve her quality of love and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, bulk grains, dairy products, meats and soft drinks..

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Mujeres Trabajadoras "Es un Comité más del Programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya, está conformado por 10 mujeres. Todas son indígenas que residen en la ciudad de Curuguaty. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, todas ellas como están aprendiendo el valor de la comunicación y el trabajo en equipo, reciben capacitación y asesoramiento y para más aprenden a ahorrar para uso futuros.
Irma es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a la mayoría de sus vecinos. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño con un pequeño negocio, pero gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y crecer con su negocio.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, comestibles y demás insumos necesarios para abastecer su local. Está muy contenta por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee "Mujeres trabajadoras" is another committee belonging to the program "Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya." It is made up of ten women. All are native to and live in the city of Curuguaty. Currently they are in their first loan cycle, and they are all learning the value of communication and working as a team. They receive training and advice and learn more how to save for the future.

Irma is one of the members of the group. She says that she has a small, well-stocked pantry with which she supplies the majority of her neighbors. She comments that she started with a small business, but thanks to work and sacrifice she has been able to come out ahead and grow along with her business. She asks for help from the foundation and from Kiva, in order to buy beverages, dairy products, edibles, and other necessary goods to supply her area. She is very happy for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, edibles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert, a 52-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda, has the responsibility of taking care of his wife and three children. He sells produce, a profitable business despite the limitations imposed by price fluctuations and inflation. Albert dreams of educating his children and buying land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Maritza, sigue laborando como ejecutiva de ventas, es madre soltera de dos hijas,una esta trabajando como cajera, y la otra estudia, ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su hija.
Ha venido mejorando su casa en estos ultimos años, atravez de financiamientos el cual le ha salido mas viable, ya que puede equilibrar sus gastos y compromiso de pago, con el credito anterior, logro avanzar mucho con el porche, lo que falta es el techo y enverjar, lo que este prestamo sera para comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, y materiales de tubos de hierro para el porche, esperando poder terminar, y gozar con su familia con esta mejora.
texts.en:
Maritza continues working as a sales executive. She is a single mother of two daughters; one is working as a cashier, and the other studies. Right now she depends on the support of her daughter.

She has been improving her house in these last few years, through financing which has made it viable for her, since she is able to balance her expenses and payment obligations. With the last loan, she was able to advance very far with the porch, and what is missing is a roof and security bars. This loan will go towards the purchase of zinc, perlins, screws, and materials of iron tubing for the porch. She is hoping to be able to finish this improvement and enjoy it with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, to finish the porch she started and didn't finish for lack of materials.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La Señora Zulma es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 39 años de edad, está acompañada con el señor José. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en una casilla en la entrada de la ciudad.
Con sacrificio y dedicación pudo llevar adelante a sus 7 hijos, con la ayuda de su esposo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, dice que siempre ha trabajado y que no teme a los desafíos. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y tener una casilla más grande, para que de esa forma siga ayudando a su familia y a su marido.
Zulma acude a la fundación y a kiva para la compra de verduras como ser tomates, locotes, zanahorias, cebollas, como así también de frutas de estación para poder surtir su negocio con productos de primera calidad para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zulma is from the city of Villarrica.  She is 39 years old and is the companion of José.  She works selling fruits and vegetables in a little shed at the entrance to the city.

With sacrifice and dedication she managed to get her seven children ahead, with the help of her husband.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She says she always has worked and she is not afraid of challenges.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing and have a bigger shed to continue helping her family and her husband.

Zulma is coming to the foundation and to Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply her business with top-quality products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa en Guayaquil.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de productos tanto personales y para el hogar, ella trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace 4 años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños, planchas y otros artefactos para el hogar ya que tiene pedidos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
The "La Unión Hace La Fuerza" (In Unity is Strength) communal bank meets every two weeks in Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the local people, which are well-known throughout the country. 

This is where we met Ana. She is 23, married, and has three children, ages 7, 4, and 2. The eldest goes to school. Her husband works at a company in Guayaquil.

She sells clothing of all kinds, as well as personal and home products. She works every day, especially in the morning hours, as at that time of day it is easier for her to make her rounds. She sells door-to-door, and fills orders. She extends credit and collects weekly. 

She says that she loves to sell, and that she has been doing this work for four years. It has gone well for her, as she has quite a few customers. She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing, as well as irons, and other home appliances, as she has orders. 

She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and likes it because of the help they give her through the loans. Her dream is for her and her family to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, children's clothing, as well as irons, and other home appliances.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “San Antonio” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2011 mediante la promoción hecha a la Sra. Edy, ella logró formar un grupo integrado por 11 mujeres de la misma zona, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Actualmente el comité ha renovado la operación. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente. Mencionaron que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Patricia comenta que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y dice que le va muy bien, ya que tiene ya una buena cantidad de Clientes. Su deseo es poder llegar a más personas con su producto, y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a sus familias con los ingresos que obtenga.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá abastecerse para tener más leche en stock, para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Women's Committee of San Antonio started working with 'La Fundación Paraguaya' in 2011. A woman named Edy was responsible for forming the group of 11 women, all of whom are from the same area. All of the women are friends and neighbors from the city of Curuguaty. Currently the group has renewed the operation of the group. The women are very united, responsible and caring. They are all very eager to work and want to get ahead, both with the group and with their families. They mentioned that they are very comfortable working as a team, with hard work and dedication, together in the Women's Committee program. 

One of the group members, Patricia, said she works starting in the earlier morning hours. She makes a living selling milk. She said her business is going very well and that she has a good number of customers. Her desire is to reach more customers with her product. With a growth in her business she will be able to continue helping her family with the profits she makes. 

Patricia has asked for a loan to be able to buy milk, so that she can increase her stock and be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk to resell.

loans.name: Izatillo

texts.ru: Изатилло женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Он трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 4 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, покупает скот на рынке «Шурнова», затем в течении двух недель откармливает их и снова продает. От этого бизнеса он получает хороший доход. В собственном доме имеет условия для скотоводства, а также имеет большое количество корма для скота. Изатилло хотел бы получить займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса и увлечения поголовье скота.
texts.en: Izatillo is married and is a responsible father of four children.  He is a hardworking and kind person.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over four years.  He buys livestock at the "Shurnova" market, then fattens it up during the course of two weeks, and then sells it again.  Izatillo earns a good income from this business.  He has suitable conditions for keeping livestock at home and also has a large quantity of livestock feed.  Izatillo wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10000 Somoni to purchase livestock in order to expand his business and increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Caaguazú, 13 señoras humildes formaron un comité con el fin de poder trabajar juntas, para un mejor porvenir de sus familias. Ellas  desean superarse como persona aportando algún ingreso dentro de sus hogares y están seguras que pueden lograrlo porque poseen la voluntad necesaria para trabajar juntas por un  mismo propósito.
Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora, y nos comenta que gracias a la despensa que tiene ha podido ayudar a su familia y darle lo que necesitan para poder tener una vida mejor sin privaciones. Ella es una mujer soñadora y tiene mucha esperanza en que la fundación y kiva la ayudarán a poder seguir creciendo como persona y como microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar, y demás artículos de primera necesidad, ya que son los productos que más vende y le gustaría poder tener más en stock.
texts.en:
In the city of Caaguazú, 13 humble women make up a committee with the end goal being to work together, to be able to better provide for their families. They want to succeed as providers for their families, bringing income into their homes. They are certain that they will be able to do so because they have the will to work together for a common purpose. 

Blanca, one of the committee members, is a very hard worker. She told us that thanks to the small store that she has, she has been able to help her family and give them the things they need to have a better life, without lacking. She is a woman with dreams and has great hope that 'la fundación' and Kiva will help her to be able to continue growing as a person and also as a small business. 

She requested a loan to buy rice, noodles, sugar and other staple food products, which are the products that she sells most in her store and of which she would like to have more in stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar and other staple food products.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Anthony is requesting another loan for 80,000 KES, which he will use to start another business. With the loan, he wants to purchase cereals, beans, peas, and rice to sell. With the first loan, his business improved and his monthly profits increased by 50 percent.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, beans, peas, and rice.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is married and has one child.  He owns a brick laying business. He started by laying 3,000 bricks per month but now lays up to 30,000 bricks.

Arthur is requesting a loan, which he will use to complete building his house.  He faces a challenge  of high price fluctuations and seasonal weather variations. Arthur wants to go back to school.

loans.use: to complete building his house.

loans.name: Ismaeel

texts.en:
Ismaeel is a 29-year-old single man.

Ismaeel has a restaurant and he is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase a coffee machine for his restaurant.

Ismaeel is looking to imptove his family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a coffee machine for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, beers and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a 32-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is taxi transportation that he started two years ago. He started  as an agent of the Coca-Cola company and raised capital to buy a car for special hiring. His challenges are high fuel and transportation costs and taxes. His dream is building a permanent house, educating his children, and also expanding his business so as to own at least two taxis. Brian needs the loan to pay for his taxi repair and servicing.

loans.use: to pay for his taxi repair and servicing.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 42-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is transportation and he is a lorry driver. His challenge is high fuel and transportation costs. His dream is educating his children to higher levels and diversifying his business to also include motorcycle transportation. Jackson needs the loan to service his lorry.

loans.use: to service his lorry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 39-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has owned a retail shop for five years. His business challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. Joseph's desire is to build a permanent house, to educate his children and to expand his business into a big retail shop. Joseph needs this loan to buy salt, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rebeca Patricia

texts.es: La señora Rebeca es divorciada tiene 2 hijos una de 23 años que ya está casada y otro más pequeño que aun depende de ella. Para Rebeca es de suma importancia ofrecer a su hijo un patrimonio en el cual pueda vivir cómodamente. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que se la pasa más de 10 horas diarias en la maquiladora para poder sustentar los gastos ya que tiene que ser madre y padre a la vez. La casa donde vive es de interés social y necesita una pintada  en las paredes de afuera porque la anterior pintura ya está muy deteriorada por el sol. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar pintura, brochas y demás herramienta para que su casa quede lista.
texts.en:
Rebeca is divorced and has two children, a 23-year-old daughter who is already married and a younger son who still depends on her.  For Rebeca it is extremely important to give her son a legacy in which he can live comfortably.  She is a very hardworking woman who spends more than ten hours a day at the "maquiladora" [factory in a free-trade zone] to be able to support the expenses, since she has to be both mother and father at the same time.  The house she lives in is social welfare housing and the outside walls need to be painted because the previous paint has deteriorated from the sun.

To do her project she needs to buy paint, brushes, and other tools to get her house ready.

loans.use: to buy paint for her house.

loans.name: Leila Marina

texts.es:
La señora Leila Marina, es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es una persona luchadora, trabajadora en conjunto con su esposo que juntos han logrado formar una familia, tener su propia vivienda para un bienestar para sus hijos.

Su negocio consiste en elaborar y vender deliciosas golosinas como arroz de leche, mota de atol, atolillo, cajetas, antefrijol, entre otras. Cabe destacar que tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que tiene gran experiencia en este oficio y sus productos son muy deliciosos y de buena calidad.

Acudió a Ceprodel para optar a un crédito para invertirlo exclusivamente en su negocio para la compra de materia prima como leña, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, arroz, cucharas, vasos, vainilla y pago de mozos, con el propósito de elaborar más dulces y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leila Marina is from the town of El Sauce.  She is a fighter and a hard worker along with her husband.  Together they have managed to have a family and have their own home for the well-being of their children.

Her business consists of making and selling delicious sweets such as rice pudding, "mota de atol" [fruit and rice custard], "atolillo" [rice custard], caramels, and "antefrijol" [custard made of beans], among others.  It is worth pointing out that she has been doing this work for many years, so she has great experience in this job and her products are very delicious and of good quality.

She came to CEPRODEL to get a loan to invest exclusively in her business, to buy ingredients such as firewood, sugar, oil, beans, rice, spoons, glasses, and vanilla, and to pay employees.  Her goal is to make more sweets and satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sugar, oil, beans, rice, spoons, glasses, and vanilla, and to pay employees.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Rendá Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Kuña Rory Renda” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya hace poco tiempo mediante la promoción hecha a una de las miembros, quien logró formar un grupo integrado por 10 mujeres de la zona, quienes son todas amigas de los alrededores. Las señoras han demostrado mucha unidad, responsabilidad y solidaridad, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante con el grupo. Mencionaron que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta.
Dolly es una de estas mujeres luchadoras. Ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de Helados de todos los sabores. Gracias a este negocio ella se ha hecho conocida y ya tiene muy buena clientela que compra de ella sus productos. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y tal vez, algún día poder tener grandes tiendas donde ofrecer sus helados.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más variedad de sabores de helados, ya que estamos en la época de calor y es cuando más venta tiene y quiere tener en stock para no perder clientes.
texts.en:
The women’s committee, Kuña Rory Renda, began to work with the Fundación Paraguaya a short time ago because of the encouragement of one of the members who succeeded in forming a group of 10 women from the area.  They are all friends from the neighborhood and have shown solidarity, responsibility and unity and are excited about working and getting ahead with the group.  They say that they really like to work as a team with a lot of effort and determination together.
Dolly is one of the fighting women.  She tells us that she sells all different flavors of ice cream.  Thanks to this business she has become known and she now has a good customer base for her products.  Her wish is to be able to continue expanding her business and one day, perhaps to have big ice cream stores.  She is requesting a loan to buy an even greater variety of ice cream since it is now the hot season and this is when she sells the most.  She wants to have stock so as not to lose customers.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell later

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en: Iskandar is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children, all of whom are studying. Iskandar strives to work really hard in order to enhance his family’s living conditions. He has been working at repairing hunting tools since 1995 and has a metal shop. He is now looking to borrow $2,100 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase needed tools and some metal supplies for his business. This Kiva loan will develop his work, thus his revenues. In the future, Iskandar plans to open his own hunting equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase the needed tools and some metal supplies for his business

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail wants a loan to buy soft drinks to resell. He is age 48 and lives in Masindi-Uganda. He has been running a bar and this has facilitated him in supporting his family. 

Ismail has the responsibility of taking care of his wife and four children. Price fluctuations and inflation hinder his business. He dreams of educating his children and saving for a wedding.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Nzuga

texts.en: Nziga is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to start another business of motorcycle transport. With this loan, he wants to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business. With the previous Kiva loan, he purchased goat meat, which earned him more profit in his goat meat business. Since the last Kiva loan, Nziga's family's living standards have improved greatly.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ramona es una emprendedora que ha cumplido uno de sus sueño de ser independiente de tener su propio negocio, este negocio para  ella ha sido muy importante, ya que ha sacado a sus hijos adelante, no es la primera vez que está solicitando financiamiento, ya que con el crédito anterior nos expresa la emprendedora ha aumentado su mercadería y sus clientes por los productos  que les ofrece. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos ya que tiene varios encargos de parte de sus clientes, con el crédito comprara lápiz labial, perfumes, cremas, pinturas entre otras productos.
texts.en:
Ramona is an enterprising woman who has fulfilled one of her dreams of being independent and of having her own business. This business has been very important to her because with it she has moved her children forward. 

This is not the first time she is requesting funding since with a former loan she has expanded her merchandise and her customers because of the products that she offers. Currently she is requesting funding to buy more products since she has several orders from her customers. With the loan she will buy lipstick, perfume, face cream and make-up, among other items.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, perfume, face cream and make-up among other items.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old and a hardworking father of 3 children. He owns a produce business, which he has been running for 11 years. He buys and sells rice and maize among other products. He started this business with a capital of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) but now has a capital of over 5,000,000 shillings. 

Patrick has a challenge of high price flactuations and his family goal is to educate his children. His business goal is to expand to new markets. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy rice and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize to sell.

loans.name: Maritza Oristila

texts.es:
La joven señora Maritza tiene 25 años, esta casada, es madre de dos hijos, tiene casa propia en la aldea el Puente y se dedica a la produccion de Nacatamales, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para empezar su produccion de nacatamales, una vez terminada sale a venderlos ambulantemente en las comunidades aledañas a su hogar. El credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de sus sabrosos nacatamales.
a sido cliente de Prisma en varias ocasiones y su deseo es seguir trabajando para lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
The young woman Maritza is 25 years old. She is married and is the mother of two children. She has her own house in the village of El Puente, and her business is producing nacatamales (a typical Nicaraguan dish similar to tamales). She has been doing this type of work for 5 years. Every day she gets up very early to begin her production of nacatamales. Once she is finished, she goes out to sell them as a walking vendor in the communities bordering her home. She will use the loan to purchase the materials for the production of her delicious natatamales.

She has been a client of Prisma on various occasions, and her wish is to continue working to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy corn meal, vegetables, olives, chicken, pork, firewood, water, and condiments to make nacatamales.

loans.name: Luz De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE VIDA” iniciará su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, comercio, producción y servicios.

La señora Juana,  indica que es la primera vez trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de conservas) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia..  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las señoras y el consultorio.

En la totografía se puede identificar a la hermana menor de una de las socias que acompaña al desembolsos, ella esta vestida de celeste.
texts.en:
The “Luz de Vida” communal bank will be starting its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana communal center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is run by a board of directors.  Juana is the treasurer.  The businesses that the members carry on are varied such as a neighborhood store, sales, production, and services.

This is the first time that Juana has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined the institution by invitation from a member.  She currently has a neighborhood store where she has been working for years.

The loan that she will now take out is to buy canned goods.  She buys them in La Ceja, and she later sells them at her store.  This work allows her to generate resources to support her family.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answered that she likes to share with the women, and she likes the clinic.

In the photo you can see the younger sister of one of the members who accompanies her to the disbursements.  She is wearing sky-blue.

loans.use: to buy canned goods.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Doña Maria, sigue con su ventas en su casa de habitacion, una pulperia que cada dia, crece al ofrecer e introducir mas productos, el hijo mayor trabaja, y los otros estudian, sigue siendo madre soltera y capaz de dar lo mejor a sus hijos.
El crecimiento y la captacion de clientes ha sido posible gracias a los prestamo que Afodenic ha dado en todos estos ciclos, logrando mantener el equilibrio en sus ventas, a si como pago de gastos personales, pago de gastos basicos y alimentacion.
Con este nuevo prestamo podra comprar granos basicos, productos lacteos, golosinas, cereales, coca cola, pollo, carne, y otros de los cuales son mas comprado por sus clientes.
texts.en:
María continues with her home-based sales, a grocery store that grows more every day as she introduces and offers more products.  Her oldest son works and the others are attending school.  She continues to be a single mother who is capable of giving her children the best.

The growth and securing of customers has been possible thanks to the loans Afodenic has given her during these cycles keeping her sales balanced as well as her personal expenses and payment of basic expenses and food.

She will use this new loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, snacks, cereals, Coca-Cola, chicken, meat and others that are the ones most bought by her customers.

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
“Virgen Del Pilar” fue denominado el comité de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Carapeguá, quienes se unieron con la esperanza de que por medio del trabajo en equipo podrán salir adelante. Actualmente se encuentran en el 4º ciclo con 11 integrantes. Son señoras que se esmeran para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Por medio de la costura que hace, Martina, una de las miembros, puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos diarios, ella dice que la vida es muy difícil, pero igual ella siempre se esfuerza mucho y trata de dar todo de ella para poder brindarle a su familia los medios necesarios para salir adelante. Comenta que tiene muchos trabajos y pedidos, por lo que no puede quejarse, aún así desea seguir creciendo para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones y demás artículos necesarios para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
This group of friends and neighbors in the city of Carapeguá was named the “Virgen Del Pilar” Communal Bank. They joined together with the hope that through working as a team they would be able to get ahead. They are currently in their 4th loan cycle and they have 11 members. These are women who are trying very hard to help their families.

Martina, one of the members, helps her family with daily expenses through her dressmaking. She says that life is very difficult however she always puts forth a great deal of effort and tries to do all that she can to provide the means necessary for her family to get ahead. She notes that she has many jobs and requests so that she cannot complain. Still, she wants to continue growing so that she can continue to help her household.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and other necessary items so that she can fill the orders that she has.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and other items.

loans.name: Abdel Aal

texts.en: Abdel Aal is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He’s the main income provider in his family, and he strives to work really hard in order to collect money and enrich his family’s way of life. For this reason, he decided to start his own business, so he opened his own car mechanic shop six years ago. He also sells spare parts for cars. Today, he is in need of borrowing $2,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase extra mechanical tools and spare parts for his garage. He notes that this will improve his work and therefore allow him to earn extra income. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his shop.

loans.use: to purchase extra mechanical tools and spare parts for his garage

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврон женат и имеет двоих детей. Жена предпринимательница. Даврон занимается торговлей женской одежды. Его магазин находится в универмаге. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для содержания семьи. Даврон хотел бы получить займ для закупа товаров и расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Davron is married and has two children. His wife is an entrepreneur. Davron sells women's clothing. His store is located in a mall. He wants to expand his business and get a good profit to support his family. Davron wants to get a loan to buy merchandise to expand his business. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothes in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Virgen De Bronce (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Virgen de Bronce está formado por 7 socias y un socio, quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió y su belleza la da su mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es amable, gentil como nuestras socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora.Carmen, tiene 25 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un taller de mecánica industrial, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Carmen se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y en sus tiempos libres trabaja en la venta de productos Avon, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También hay veces que le llaman y trabaja en un gabinete de belleza.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos Avon.
 
Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgin of Bronce is made up of 7 women and one man who live in various places in the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate, and its mix of the colonial and the modern gives it its beauty. The people are friendly, kind like our members who work in different businesses that allow them to contribute to their household costs and raise their families. The people continue the culture and traditions of their villages. 

One of the members of this group is Carmen. She is 25 years old, married, and in her marriage has had 2 children who are 7 and 3 years old. Her first son is studying in a city school. Her husband works in an industrial mechanic shop. She doesn’t have her own home and for that reason she is renting. 

Carmen cares for her children and in her free time works selling Avon products. She works from Sunday to Sunday without set hours. Also, there’s times that they call her and she works in a beauty salon. 

This is her first loan that she’s gotten in the communal bank which her sister-in-law invited her into. She will invest her loan into the purchase of Avon products. 

Her goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, desde hace rato lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, con perseverancia y objetivo propuestos. Este negocio es una herramienta de trabajo vital para él y su familia, lo aprendió de forma empírica por la necesidad de generar ingresos a su familia. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para  invertir en el negocio en la compra de ropa en general, calzado, perfumes, lápiz labial y más productos.
texts.en: Wilfredo has been working with Fundación León 2000 for awhile. He has shown himself to be a responsible, persevering person with a clear objective. This business is a vital tool for him and his family. He learned it on his own because of the necessity of generating an income for his family. Currently he is requesting a loan to invest in his business by purchasing general clothing, footwear, perfume, lipstick and other products.

loans.use: to buy general clothing, footwear, perfume, lipstick and other items.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro es una emprendedora que ha luchado por tener su propio negocio y salir adelante y tenerlo bien surtido. Ella ya ha tenido financiamiento con Fundación León 2000, en el cual su record crediticio es muy bueno es una excelente cliente, ella nos expresa que con el financiamiento ha aumentado su negocio y su clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para volver a invertir en el negocio en la compra de sabanas, toallas, calzado, cosméticos y ropa en general.
texts.en: María del Socorro is an entrepreneur who has struggled to have her own business, get ahead and keep it well stocked.  She has had prior financing from Fundación León 2000 and her credit history is very good; she’s an excellent client.  She tells us that with the financing her business and her clientele have increased.  She’s currently asking for financing to once again invest in the business with the purchase of sheets, towels, footwear, cosmetics and clothing in general.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, footwear, cosmetics and clothing in general.

loans.name: Lorena Cleotilde

texts.es: Lorena Cleotilde tiene 45 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería en el cual tiene años de experiencia y saben los que sus clientes necesidad. Cuando inicio este negocio no sabía nada de el pero con mucho empeño y esfuerzo lo hecho adelante. Lorena está solicitando financiamiento para el negocio para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos entre otros productos que mas demandan.
texts.en: Lorena Cleotilde, 45, runs a grocery store that she has several years’ experience in and knows what her customers need.  When she started the business she didn’t know anything about it but with much effort and dedication she’s caused it to move ahead.  Lorena is asking for financing for the business to buy snacks and basic grains, among other high demand products.

loans.use: to buy snacks and basic grains among other high demand products.

loans.name: Raad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old and married, and has four children, two of whom work.

Raad has been the owner of a food market since 2008, selling frozen beef, chicken, and fish. He has a sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to purchase a large refrigerator for his market. He aims to gain more profits, which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large refrigerator for his market.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Luis quien es estibador, fruto de esa unión tiene 04 hijos y juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Patricia es la venta de comida, como juanes, tamales, y otros platillos, para lo cual se instala en el frontis de su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, que en su  mayoría son sus vecinos. Realiza éste negocio desde hace 06 años con un capital propio, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo en la atención hacía los clientes. Le agrada su negocio pues le hacer ser una persona independiente y puede ayudar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar. Tiene planes de abrir un bodega en su casa, con lo cual se estaría generando mas ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su negocio de comidas comprando ingredientes, como: arroz, aceite, huevos al por mayor para así generarse mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Patricia, 43, is a hardworking and dedicated woman who has a strong desire to get ahead.  She lives with Luis, who is a longshoreman, and they have 4 children together.  They live in their own home.  Patricia has a business selling food, such as juanes (a traditional dish made of seasoned rice that is steamed inside of a large leaf), tamales and other dishes.  Her business is set up at the front of her house, and this is where she provides very friendly service to her customers, most of whom are her neighbors.  She started this business 6 years ago with her own capital, and now she relies on help from her son to tend to the customers.  She likes her business because it allows her to be an independent person and help her partner with the household expenses.  She has plans to open a store in her house, which would allow her to generate more income and improve her quality of life.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and so she awaits your support so that she can put her plans into action.  With the sum of 800 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy ingredients for her business, such as rice, cooking oil and eggs at wholesale.  This way she will be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and eggs at wholesale

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Файзулло женат и имеет троих детей. Жена работает бухгалтером. Более 5 лет он занимается производством мебели. В основном он производит двуспальные кровати. Файзулло начал свой бизнес с братьями, а сейчас сам занимается этим бизнесом. Данный момент Файзулло хочет покупать автомашины для перевозки мебели. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Faizullo is married and has three children. His wife works as an accountant. He has been manufacturing furniture for more than five years. He mainly makes double beds. Faizullo started his business with his brothers and now runs it alone. At this time Faizullo wants to buy a vehicle for transportation of the furniture. He is asking for a loan for 10,000 somoni for this purpose. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car for transportation of furniture.

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es:
Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, hasta el 2009 perteneció al Banco Comunal Poder, el cual se dividió en 2 al ser este un Banco Comunal grande, siendo las socias las que escogieron si quedarse en el Banco Comunal o separarse formando así el Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, la elección se debió a la disponibilidad de tiempo de sus socias para participar, pues ambos Bancos Comunales atendían en diferentes horarios.
Eudomilia tiene 67 años, es de profesión Profesora, y en su casa tiene una bodega, es la Presidenta de su Banco Comunal, esta muy feliz y satisfecha por todo lo que pudo lograr, recuerda que con mucho esfuerzo pudo salir adelante, ahora con su esposo esta bien, y la relación con los años se torna mas fuerte, aprendió mucho en Finca, y aprendió a ser una líder en Finca, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de barquillo para helados y arroz, azúcar.
texts.en:
Eudomilia is a member of the Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza (Mustard Seed Community Bank). Up until 2009 she belonged to the Power Communal Bank, which subsequently was split into two groups since those members who decided to stay formed the Power Communal Bank and the other formed the Mustard Seed bank. The choice was made according to the availability of the members to participate since both banks operate on different schedules. 

She is 67 years old, she is a teacher and she has set up a grocery store in her house. She is the president of her Communal Bank, and she is very happy for and satisfied with everything she has been able to achieve. She remembers the great efforts she had to make to get ahead, and now she and her husband enjoy good conditions, and with the passing of the years their relationship has become stronger. She has learned a lot thanks to Finca Peru, and she has learned how to be a leader in Finca. The loans she is currently requesting will be used to buy wafers for ice-creams, rice and sugar.

loans.use: To buy wafers for ice-creams, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан трудолюбивый, умный и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих сыновей. Чтобы содержать их в хороших условиях жизни и обеспечить их всем он решил заниматься купле- продажей продуктов питания. Его торговая точка находится на многолюдном месте. Так как у него много постоянных клиентов, он всегда привозит и продает свежие продукты. Товар привозит с другого кишлака Навобод и продает с наценкой по более высокой цене. Хасан запрашивает займ для расширения оборотного капитала и развития бизнеса и расширения ассортимента продуктов.
texts.en: Hasan is a hardworking, smart and kind person.  He is married and is raising three sons.  In order to provide good living conditions for them and meets all of their needs, he is involved in buying and selling food products.  His retail outlet is located in a well-traveled place.  Because he has many regular customers, Hasan always brings in and sells fresh products.  He delivers his products from a neighboring village, Navobod, and sells them with a markup at a higher price.  Hasan is requesting this loan to increase his working capital, develop his business and expand product selection.

loans.use: to increase working capital, develop the business and expand product selection

loans.name: Mayaqui 2012 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAYAQUI 2012” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betzabe es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de carne de chancho, kiosco de comida, producción de balones.

La señora Betzabe,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicios de comida y bebida que viene trabajando hace años, el mismo que aprendió de sus anteriores trabajos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de gaseosas) que adquiere de los promotores que van a su negocio  y posteriormente lo comercializará en las puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The Mayaqui 2012 communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo community center.  It is comprised of eight members and run by a board of directors.  Betzabe is the president.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied such as knitting sweaters, selling food, selling clothes, selling pork, a food kiosk, and manufacturing balls.

This is the first time that Bezabe has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined the institution by invitation from a member.  She currently has a business providing food and beverage services, which she has been doing for years.  She learned how to do this from her previous jobs.

The loan that she will now take out is to buy soft drinks from the promoters who come to her business.  She later sells them at stand where she sells.  Working this way allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun sells clothing and his wife helps him with his work.  He has two daughters and a son.  His two daughters are grown and married, and his son has finished school and now is serving in Armenian army.

This is Harutyun's third Kiva-funded loan. He used previous loans to diversify his business offerings, and now he has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy men’s and women’s spring jackets, shirts, and blouses to resell.

loans.use: to buy men’s and women’s spring jackets, shirts, and blouses to resell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel, de 48 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y decidido, con muchas ganas de progresar. Convive con Elita quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos, y juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Gabriel es la venta de envases plásticos como tinas, baldes, jarras que los vende de manera ambulante. Realizando el traslado de sus productos con un motocarro, cuyo uso paga por día. Tiene más de 01 año desempeñando dicha actividad, pues le genera un ingreso económico con el cual puede apoyar con los gastos de su hogar. Sin embargo algunos productos lo vende a crédito, y hay veces en que sus clientes no terminan de pagar perjudicándolo en las ganancias. Tiene como plan abrir un restaurante, ya que sabe cocinar y desea ponerlo en práctica. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido de contar con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más envases en mayor volumen buscando precios más bajos, para así tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gabriel, 48, is a hardworking, focused man who very much wants to make progress.  He lives with Elita who is a merchant; they have three children and live together in their own house.

Gabriel’s activity is selling various plastic containers like tubs, buckets and jugs that he sells in an ambulatory fashion moving his goods from place to place in a car that he leases daily.  He’s been in this line of work for over a year for it generates income that he can meet household expenses with.  However, he sells some of his items on credit and sometimes his customers don’t completely pay him off which hurts his profits.

His plan is to open a restaurant since he knows how to cook and wants to put it into practice.  This will be MFP loan #2.  He feels grateful to be able to count on financial support to get ahead with his business.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more plastic container in larger amounts thus seeking the lowest process to have higher income.

loans.use: to buy more plastic containers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 25-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a retailer for the last three years, and his major challenges are price fluctuation, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and expanding his business to new areas. Samuel needs a loan to buy sodas and beers for resale.

loans.use: to buy soda and beers for resale.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is a 23-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his child. He has been running a bar for the last three years and his major hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, however, he has a goal of expanding it to new areas. Jerome needs the loan to buy beers for selling.

loans.use: to buy beers for selling

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson wants a loan to buy soft drinks for selling. He is a 28-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been running a bar and with the proceeds, he has been able to look after his wife and children. Price fluctuations and inflation hinder his business and his dream is to own a hotel.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for selling

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Юлдош занимается торговлей риса. В торговле ему помогает жена. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки риса.
texts.en: Yuldosh deals in rice. His wife helps him with this business. They have been selling rice for the last five years. Yuldosh is taking out this credit to purchase more rice for his store.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Eshdavlat

texts.ru: Эшдавлат проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается всей семьей. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Eshdavlat live in the Shahrituz region. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. Eshdavlat's entire family raises cattle for a living. He is taking out this loan to purchase additional animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода проживает в городе Исфара. Она занимается торговлей шапок и домашних тапочек. Ей 42 года. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Озода берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Ozada lives in the city of Isfara. She is 42 years old, widowed and has three children. For the last ten years Ozada has been selling hats and house shoes from her market stall. Now she is taking out this loan to increase goods turnover for her business.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married lady, aged 46 years and blessed with three children aged 14, eight and two years. Her spouse is David, a military officer. Rosalia buys milk from the local farmers for resale in the Ndatabwa trading center and has been in operation for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,500.

She is asking for a third loan term from KADET LTD of KES 30,000 after she successfully repaid the previous ones and wishes to use this amount to pay the milk suppliers. The profit amount will be used to pay for school fees for her school-going children.

Her dream is to become self-sustainable.

loans.use: to pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 49 years old. She lives in Yerevan and has run a women’s clothes trading business for more than 11 years. She rents a small stall at one of the trading markets, where she sells blouses, dresses and trousers. Before starting her own business, Narine worked as an accountant at different organizations. 

Narine’s husband is a tailor and he sews clothes to order and also helps his wife in her business. Narine’s son works at a workshop where he repairs mobile phones; her daughter works at a hospital as a nurse. 

Thanks to her occupation, Narine solves a major part of her family’s needs. She is asking for a 750,000 AMD loan to buy spring dresses and blouses to resell.

loans.use: to buy spring dresses and blouses to resell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, Mwaka has operated a clothing sales business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Mwaka's major challenge is seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to get more profit.

Mwaka plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is taking out another Kiva loan to boost her fish selling business. She plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of dried fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Benito Martin

texts.es: Benito es  un emprendedor que le gusta  atender su negocio de frutas y verduras  es un emprendedor éxito, ya que cumplió uno de sus grandes sueños de tener su propio negocio en el cual es su herramienta principal de trabajo por que saca los ingresos diarios para los gastos del hogar.
